description: FusionTime offers wide variety of methods for controlling the chart behaviour ranging from exporting, loading data, resizing, set binning of the time-series charts etc. Find the comprehensive list of methods below.

methods.name: setBinning
methods.description: Overrides the binning rules followed by the chart with the binning rules provided to this API. If some time unit is missing from the input binning rules, then the default multipliers for that time unit will be used by the chart. If any incorrect multipliers are provided to a unit, they will be ignored.

subparams.name: millisecond
subparams.description: All the multipliers applicable for the millisecond unit.

subparams.name: second
subparams.description: All the multipliers applicable for the second unit.

subparams.name: minute
subparams.description: All the multipliers applicable for the minute unit

subparams.name: hour
subparams.description: All the multipliers applicable for the hour unit.

subparams.name: day
subparams.description: All the multipliers applicable for the day unit.

subparams.name: month
subparams.description: All the multipliers applicable for the month unit.

subparams.name: year
subparams.description: All the multipliers applicable for the year unit.

methods.name: getBinning
methods.description: Returns the binning rules that are being followed by the chart. If any custom binning rules are in effect, the returned rules will take into account the modifications made by them as well.

subparams.name: millisecond
subparams.description: All the multipliers applicable for the millisecond unit.

subparams.name: second
subparams.description: All the multipliers applicable for the second unit.

subparams.name: minute
subparams.description: All the multipliers applicable for the minute unit

subparams.name: hour
subparams.description: All the multipliers applicable for the hour unit.

subparams.name: day
subparams.description: All the multipliers applicable for the day unit.

subparams.name: month
subparams.description: All the multipliers applicable for the month unit.

subparams.name: year
subparams.description: All the multipliers applicable for the year unit.

methods.name: setCurrentBin
methods.description: Sets the provided unit and multiplier as the current binning in the chart by adjusting spread of time on the focus canvases. The provided multiplier must be a valid multiplier for the given time unit (as per the currently active binning rules in the chart). If it is not, then there is no visible effect of calling this method. If the multiplier is not provided, it is assumed to be 1. If the unit is not provided, there should be no visible effect of calling this method.

subparams.name: unit
subparams.description: The unit of time to be represented in each bin - `millisecond`, `second`, `minute`, `hour`, `day`, `month` or `year`.

subparams.name: multiplier
subparams.description: The multiplier for the `unit` to be represented in each bin.

methods.name: getCurrentBin
methods.description: Provides information about the binning applied in the chart when the method was invoked.

subparams.name: unit
subparams.description: The unit of time to be represented in each bin - `millisecond`, `second`, `minute`, `hour`, `day`, `month` or `year`.

subparams.name: multiplier
subparams.description: The multiplier for the `unit` to be represented in each bin.

methods.name: setTimeSelection
methods.description: Updates the start and end time of the time selection on the focus canvases. This will also result in a change across all of the chart’s components accordingly.

subparams.name: start
subparams.description: The UNIX timestamp corresponding to the time at which to start the time selection visible on the focus canvases.

subparams.name: end
subparams.description: The UNIX timestamp corresponding to the time at which to end the time selection visible on the focus canvases.

methods.name: getTimeSelection
methods.description: Provides start and end UNIX timestamps of the visible window of the time axis.

subparams.name: start
subparams.description: The UNIX timestamp corresponding to the time at which to start the time selection visible on the focus canvases.

subparams.name: end
subparams.description: The UNIX timestamp corresponding to the time at which to end the time selection visible on the focus canvases.

methods.name: resizeTo
methods.description:
Resizes the chart to the specified width and height. The values for the width and height are passed, in pixels or percentage, as parameters to this function. If the function is called without any parameters, it __returns__ the current value of the chart width and height. 

 This function is useful in controlling the chart dimensions based on changes in the dimensions of a resizable dialog box. It is also useful in resizing charts for responsive layouts, based on device orientation change. 

 

 >When the chart dimensions are set in percentage, the chart partially redraws itself when the chart container is resized. The chart uses a very low-profile polling, at an interval of __300 ms__ to check whether the container has effectively resized.

subparams.name: width
subparams.description: Chart width to set, in pixels or percentage

subparams.name: height
subparams.description: Chart height to set, in pixels or percentage

methods.name: lockResize
methods.description: Allows users to controls whether the chart will be dynamically resizable or not when rendered using percent height and width.

subparams.name: state
subparams.description: Setting this parameter to __true__ will lock the automatic percentage-based resizing. If resize is already locked, sending `false` unlocks it.

methods.name: getSVGString
methods.description: Returns the SVG string of a chart. This function can be called only after the chart has rendered.

subparams.name: callBackFN( svgString )
subparams.description: callBackFN is called only when `getSVGString()` completes its execution.

subparams.name: keepImages
subparams.description: To get the images present in the chart from the SVG string, set the parameter of `keepImages` object to `1`.

methods.name: batchExport
methods.description: Exports multiple charts in a single image. This method either takes __no arguments__ or takes __an object as an argument__.

subparams.name: imageWidth
subparams.description: Width of the exported image (of the charts)

subparams.name: imageHeight
subparams.description: Height of the exported image (of the charts)
subparams.defaultvalue: (Total height of all charts + 5) * (number of charts + 1)

subparams.name: charts
subparams.description: The configuration required for the chart(s) being exported can be provided in this object using the attributes given below:

subparams.name: charts.id
subparams.description: Valid FusionCharts ID, to attach the chart on the main image

subparams.name: charts.x
subparams.description: x-coordinate for positioning the exported image

subparams.name: charts.y
subparams.description: y-coordinate for positioning the exported image

subparams.name: charts.width
subparams.description:
Custom width for the exported image 

 __Note__: If only one value from the width and the height of the chart is provided, the value of the other is calculated in a way that the aspect ratio is maintained.

subparams.name: charts.height
subparams.description:
Custom height for the exported image 

 __Note__: If only one value from the width and the height of the chart is provided, the value of the other is calculated in a way that the aspect ratio is maintained.

subparams.name: background
subparams.description: The configuration required for the exported image's background can be provided in this object using the attributes given below:

subparams.name: background.bgColor
subparams.description: Background color for the exported image

subparams.name: background.bgImage
subparams.description: Background image for the exported images

subparams.name: background.bgImageAlpha
subparams.description: Transparency of the background image

subparams.name: background.bgImageX
subparams.description: Starting x-coordinate for positioning the background image

subparams.name: background.bgImageY
subparams.description: Starting y-coordinate for positioning the background image

subparams.name: background.bgImageWidth
subparams.description:
Width of the background image 

 __Note__: If only one value from the width and the height is provided, the value of the other is calculated in a way that the aspect ratio is maintained.

subparams.name: background.bgImageHeight
subparams.description:
Height of the background image 

 __Note__: If only one value from the width and the height is provided, the value of the other is calculated in a way that the aspect ratio is maintained.

subparams.name: exportTargetWindow
subparams.description:
Set to `_self` to open the exported image in the same window 

 Set to `_blank` to open the exported image in a new window

subparams.name: exportAction
subparams.description:
Set to `_save` to save the exported image on the server 

 Set to `_download` to send back the image to the client as a download

subparams.name: exportFileName
subparams.description: Default file name (excluding the extension) for the exported image

subparams.name: exportHandler
subparams.description:
__For server-side exporting__: Path of the export handler (the ready-to-use scripts provided by FusionTime) 

 __For client-side exporting__: DOM ID of the FusionTime Export Component embedded in the web page, along with the chart

subparams.name: exportFormats
subparams.description:
List of formats in which the chart can be exported 

 The formats are separated using the *|* (pipe) character.

subparams.name: exportCallback
subparams.description: Name of the JavaScript function that is called when the export process finishes

subparams.name: exportAtClientSide
subparams.description: Set to `1` to enable client-side exporting

methods.name: getChartData
methods.description: Fetches the data set when a chart has been rendered.

subparams.name: format
subparams.description: Format in which chart data has to be retrieved

methods.syntax:
<select id="data_format">
     	    <option value="csv">CSV</option>
     	    <option value="json">JSON</option>
     	</select>     	

FusionCharts.ready(function() {
	var myChart = new FusionCharts({
		type: "timeseries",
    	renderAt: "container",
		width: "100%",
		height: 400,
		id: "chart1",
		dataSource: {}
	}).render();

var format = document.getElementById("data_format").value;
//getChartData fetches the data set for a chart
var data = FusionCharts.getChartData(format);
}

methods.name: setChartData
methods.description:
Sets the data for a chart. 

When this function is called on a chart that is already rendered, the chart is instantly updated with the new data. When it is used to set data for a chart before it has rendered, data is initially stored internally and is passed to the chart when it is rendered. 

 

 >A preferrable alternative to using the `setChartData()` method is to pass chart data to the `dataSource` attribute of the FusionTime constructor.

subparams.name: data
subparams.description: Data to be passed to the chart

subparams.name: format
subparams.description:
Format of the data being passed. If the value for this parameter is not a valid [dataFormat](/api/fusioncharts/fusioncharts-properties#dataFormats), then the default or previously set data format is assumed. 

 >If the data format is already known, then the [setJSONData()](/api/fusioncharts/fusioncharts-methods#setJSONData) or the [setXMLData()](/api/fusioncharts/fusioncharts-methods#setXMLData) methods can be used.

methods.name: getChartAttribute
methods.description: Fetches value of chart attributes explicitly applied to the root `chart` object (or the `<chart>` node element).

subparams.name: attribute
subparams.description: To fetch the value of a single attribute, pass the attribute name as a string. For multiple attributes, pass an array of attribute names. Values will be returned in the order of the attribute names in the array.

methods.name: setChartAttribute
methods.description: Updates a chart's attributes with a new attribute-value pair, thus updating the chart's data definition root (the `<chart>` node in the XML data or the `chart` object in the JSON data).

subparams.name: attributes
subparams.description: To set/update multiple attributes at once, an object containing all the key-value pairs is passed. In case of a single value, a string that is the key (the attribute name) is passed.

subparams.name: value
subparams.description: If the `attributes` parameter is a single string value, the `value` parameter contains the value for that key.

methods.name: addEventListener
methods.description: Used to attach an event to the chart.

subparams.name: type
subparams.description: Type (name) of the event to listen to. To register the listener for multiple events in the same registration call, provide all event names as an array.

subparams.name: listener
subparams.description:
Function to be exceuted when the event is triggered. If multiple listeners are bound to an event, the listeners are executed in the order of definition, with arguments specific to the triggered event. 

 >Click [here](http://www.fusioncharts.com/dev/api/fusioncharts/fusioncharts-typedefs.html#eventListener) to read more about the eventListener arguments.

methods.name: removeEventListener
methods.description: Used to remove an event attached to the chart.

subparams.name: type
subparams.description: Type (name) of the event whose listener(s) has to be removed

subparams.name: listener
subparams.description: Listener function to remove

methods.name: getObjectReference
methods.description: Return the DOM element created by FusionTime in which charts will be rendered `<span>`

subparams.name: id
subparams.description: ID of the chart, whose `DOMElement` is to be referenced.

methods.name: clone
methods.description: Creates a copy of a chart instance, creating a new chart with identical construction properties of the chart being cloned. The cloned chart, assigned an auto-generated ID, is rendered in a container DOM element that is explicitly provided.

subparams.name: overrides
subparams.description: Object containing instructions for changes in the cloned chart. For example, passing `pieChart.clone({type: 'column2d'});` will clone the pie chart, but set its chart-type as `column2d`. It accepts all the construction parameters of a new FusionTime instance.

subparams.name: argsOnly
subparams.description: Set to __true__, if a new FusionCharts object is not required. In that case, it causes the function to return a serializable object that can later be passed to create a new FusionTime instance, and therefore, create a clone.

methods.name: ready
methods.description: Accepts a function as an argument and that is executed by FusionTime when the page is ready (library loaded, DOM elements rendered).

subparams.name: readyCallback
subparams.description: Callback function executed when the FusionTime framework is ready

subparams.name: args
subparams.description: Argument to be passed to the callback function

subparams.name: context
subparams.description: To execute a function, passed using the `fn` parameter, in a different scope than the default [FusionCharts](/api/fusioncharts) scope, pass the appropriate class object here.

methods.name: dataReady
methods.description: Determines whether a chart will render properly with the data set and returns true or false.

subparams.name: available
subparams.description: Setting this parameter to __true__ returns the status of the data, irrespective of its compatibility with the chart type. In that case, this function will return __false__ if data provided to the chart triggers the [dataLoadError](/api/fusioncharts/fusioncharts-events#event-dataLoadError) or [dataInvalid](/api/fusioncharts/fusioncharts-events#event-dataInvalid) events

methods.name: hasRendered
methods.description: Returns true if the chart has rendered successfully, false if it has not.

methods.name: print
methods.description: Prints individual charts. It hides all elements on a page except the chart to print and then invokes the page printing function (`window.print()`).

subparams.name: options
subparams.description: Object containing the printing options configured

subparams.name: options.hideButtons
subparams.description: Hides all buttons on the chart

methods.name: exportChart
methods.description: Exports a chart as an image or as a PDF document.

subparams.name: options
subparams.description: The `exportChart` method takes the following parameters:

subparams.name: options.exportFormat
subparams.description:
A chart can be exported in one of the following formats:  

 | Export Format | Description | 

 | --------- | :-------------| 

 | `png`| Exports the charts in the high quality lossless PNG format | 

 | `jpg` | Exports the chart in the high quality JPEG image format       | 

 | `pdf` | Exports the chart as a PDF document |

subparams.name: options.exportFileName
subparams.description: File name for the chart being exported, excluding the extension. The extension is automatically appended depending on the value of `exportFormat` parameter.

subparams.name: options.exportTargetWindow
subparams.description: When the `exportAction` parameter is set to `download` as , this parameter lets you configure whether the return image or PDF will open in the same window (as an attachment for download), or in a new browser window (`_blank`).

subparams.name: options.exportHandler
subparams.description: URL of the export server

subparams.name: options.exportAction
subparams.description:
Specifies whether the exported image will be sent back to the browser as download, or whether it will be saved on to the server.  

 | Action Value | Description | 

 | ----------| :------------------------| 

 | `download` | The exported chart image or PDF will be downloaded as file. | 

 | `save` | The exported chart will be saved on the server.| 

 

 >For the charts to be saved on the server, you would need to setup your own export handling server.

subparams.name: options.exportCallback
subparams.description: Callback JavaScript function executed when the export process is complete. If this parameter is not assigned a value, then the `window.FC_Exported` is executed.

methods.name: showChartMessage
methods.description: Shows a text message on a chart.

subparams.name: text
subparams.description: Text message to be displayed

subparams.name: modal
subparams.description: Boolean value to indicate whether the message will be shown on an overlay button or on the chart.

subparams.name: cancelable
subparams.description:
If set to __true__, the modal can be closed by clicking. Defaults to __false__. 

 >Applicable only if `modal` is set to __true__.

methods.name: render
methods.description: Renders a chart inside a container element on a page. If the chart is already rendered, it can be re-rendered inside the same container DOM element or a different element.

subparams.name: containerElement
subparams.description: Reference or ID of the DOM element inside which the chart is to be rendered. If this argument is not provided, it is assumed that the `renderAt` attribute is provided during chart creation.

subparams.name: insertMode
subparams.description: Method for inserting the chart's DOM element within the `containerElement`. Click [here](/api/fusioncharts/fusioncharts-properties#DOMInsertModes) to read more about  the DOM insert modes.

subparams.name: callback
subparams.description: Callback function executed after the chart is successfully rendered. If the last parameter to the `render()` function is a function, it is treated as a callback.

methods.name: Dispose
methods.description: Disposes a chart completely, when called on an instance of FusionCharts. This clears the entire chart object and removes it from the DOM tree structure. When the chart is successfully disposed, `chartInstance.disposed` is set to __true__.

methods.name: configure
methods.description: Configures status messages that are displayed while rendering a chart. For example, while a chart's data is being fetched from a remote URL, the chart will display the message __Retrieving data. Please wait.__

subparams.name: option
subparams.description: To configure a single attribute, specify the attribute (the key) as a string. To configure multiple attributes, this can be an object having key-value pairs of all configuration options.

subparams.name: value
subparams.description: If the `option` parameter has a single value as the key, this parameter is the value of that key.

methods.name: FeedData
methods.description: Adds data to the chart in real-time.

subparams.name: stream
subparams.description: Real-time data for charts and gauges.
